etymologies: early 19th century: from French stratégique, from Greek stratēgikos, from stratēgos (see stratagem)

definitions: relating to the identification of long-term or overall aims and interests and the means of achieving them

examples.text: the company should take strategic actions to cope with fundamental changes in the environment
strategic planning for the organization is the responsibility of top management

shortDefinitions: relating to identification of long-term or overall aims and interests

definitions: carefully designed or planned to serve a particular purpose or advantage

examples.text: alarms are positioned at strategic points around the prison

shortDefinitions: carefully designed or planned to serve particular purpose or advantage

definitions: relating to the gaining of overall or long-term military advantage

examples.text: New Orleans was of strategic importance
a hazard to British strategic and commercial interests

shortDefinitions: relating to gaining of overall or long-term military advantage

definitions: (of human or material resources) essential in fighting a war

examples.text: the strategic forces on Russian territory

shortDefinitions: (of human or material resources) essential in fighting war

definitions: (of bombing or weapons) done or for use against industrial areas and communication centers of enemy territory as a long-term military objective
shortDefinitions: (of bombing or weapons) done or for use against industrial areas and communication centers of enemy territory
